greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) (0<=k<=n) is the number of Delannoy paths of length n that start with exactly k (1,1) steps.
comment: A Delannoy path of length n is a path from (0,0) to (n,n), consisting of steps E=(1,0), N=(0,1) and D=(1,1).

Row sums are the central Delannoy numbers (A001850). Column 0 yields A110170 (first differences of the central Delannoy numbers). sum(k*T(n,k),k=0..n)=A089165(n-1) (n>=1; partial sums of the central Delannoy numbers).
link: Robert A. Sulanke, Objects Counted by the Central Delannoy Numbers, Journal of Integer Sequences, Volume 6, 2003, Article 03.1.5.
formula: T(n, k) = P_{n-k}(3)-P_{n-k-1}(3) for k<n; T(n, n)=1, where P_j is j-th Legendre polynomial.
example: T(3,2)=2 because we have DDNE and DDEN.
maple: with(orthopoly): S:=proc(n,k) if k<n then P(n-k,3)-P(n-k-1,3) elif k=n then 1 else 0 fi end: for n from 0 to 10 do seq(S(n,k),k=0..n) od; # yields sequence in triangular form
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Jul 14 2005
ext: Keyword tabf changed to tabl by _Michel Marcus_, Apr 09 2013
